Functions

int parm_opt (double *a, int n_parm, int n_con, double tol, void(*f_dLda)(), void(*f_dMda)(), void(*f_M)(), double(*f_L)(), double *final_cost, double *err)

Detailed Description

============================================================================= ==============================================================================

Author:
Stefan Schaal
Date:
February 1994
==============================================================================
Remarks:
program for parameter optimization with hard constraints, e.g., typically modeled by Lagrange multipliers. Both Newton's method and normal gradient method are implemented

============================================================================

Definition in file parm_opt.old.c.

Function Documentation

int parm_opt ( double *  a,
int  n_parm,
int  n_con,
double  tol,
void(*)()  f_dLda,
void(*)()  f_dMda,
void(*)()  f_M,
double(*)()  f_L,
double *  final_cost,
double *  err 
)

*****************************************************************************

Note:
parm_opt
Date:
10/20/91
Remarks:
this is the major optimzation program
Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output

Parameters:
[in] tol : error tolernance to be achieved
[in] n_parm : number of parameters to be optimzed
[in] n_con : number of contraints to be taken into account
[in] f_dLda : function which calculates the derivative of the optimziation criterion with respect to the parameters; must return vector
[in] f_dMda : function which calculates the derivate of the constraints with respect to parameters must return matrix
[in] f_M : constraints function, must always be formulted to return 0 for properly fulfilled constraints
[in] f_L : function to calculate simple cost (i.e., constraint cost NOT included), the constraint costs are added by this program automatically, the function returns a double scalar
[in,out] a : initial setting of parameters and also return of optimal value (must be a vector, even if scalar)
[out] final_cost,: the final cost
[out] err : the sqrt of the squared error of all constraints
NOTE: - program returns TRUE if everything correct, otherwise FALSE
  • always minimizes the cost!!!
  • algorithms come from Dyer McReynolds
